snippet: Senator Frank R. Lautenberg of New Jersey has embraced his job with new vigor, even as Cory Booker, the mayor of Newark, has said that he will seek the seat.
abstract: Democratic Senator Frank R Lautenberg of New Jersey has embraced his job with new vigor, even as Cory A Booker, the mayor of Newark, has said that he will seek the seat; most in his inner circle say the 89-year-old will ultimately decide to retire as oldest member of the Senate, but some say he is convincing when he talks about another campaign.

byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and RAYMOND HERNANDEZ

lead_paragraph: Senator Frank R. Lautenberg of New Jersey has embraced his job with new vigor, even as Cory Booker, the mayor of Newark, has said that he will seek the seat.

headline.seo: Challenged at 89, Senator Frank R. Lautenberg Does Not Go Gentle
headline.main: Challenged for His Seat at 89, a Senator Does Not Go Gentle
headline.print_headline: Challenged for His Seat at 89, A Senator Does Not Go Gentle
